bioghist.p: Lily Ross Taylor (1886-1969) was professor of Latin and chair of the department at Bryn Mawr College from 1927 to 1952. She was named Dean of the Graduate School in 1942. Prior to teaching at Bryn Mawr, she had served on the faculty of Vassar College and was the first female Fellow of the American Academy in Rome. She earned both her master's degree and doctorate in Latin from Bryn Mawr. After her retirement in 1952, she remained active as professor in charge of the Classical School of the American Academy in Rome, Phi Beta Kappa Visiting Scholar, visiting professor in various universities, and Member at the Institute for Advanced Study in Princeton.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the professional and private papers of Lily Ross Taylor. Materials include: lectures; notes, drafts, and manuscripts of articles, reviews, and other writings; correspondence with professional organizations, fellow scholars, and editors; correspondence related to the Friends of the Library of the American Academy in Rome; Taylor's letter of appointment to Bryn Mawr; documentation of honors and awards; newspaper clippings; bibliographies of Taylor's publications; Latin exams and student translations from Vassar; and letters of sympathy received by Agnes K. Michels upon Taylor's death.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
